p: Through unremitting efforts, several developed countries have eliminated FMD and remain free of the disease, however FMD is still prevalent in many developing countries. In China, recent FMD epidemics have mainly been caused by serotypes A and O, FMD serotype Asia 1 has not been reported since 2009 ( Jijun, Jianhong & Xiangtao, 2015). Between January 2013 and May 2017, 44 FMD outbreaks were reported by the Ministry of Agriculture of the Peopleâ€™s Republic of China, 26 of which were caused by serotype A, and 18 by serotype O. The total number of diseased animals during this period was 2485, and 10,939 animals were sacrificed ( Figs. 1A and 1B). As shown in Fig. 1, the number of FMD outbreaks reported in 2017 was higher than in 2016, which is a reminder that more effective measures must be implemented to prevent future epidemics.
